result.execSummary:
The defendant Javier Esquivel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Mistreatment of Animals/Cause Death, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
----------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
----------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with the owner of the cat. No unsupervised contact with any domestic animal.
----------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
------------------------------

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence on or before 03/23/2016 at 8:00 a.m.
To complete a total of forty (40) hours of community service work during the period of probation ordered WITHOUT buyout option.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Javier Esquivel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Javier  Esquivel in court with attorney James Michael Dickinson.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

Defendant Javier  Esquivel in court with attorney James Michael Dickinson.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved. Motion deadline 03/10/2016.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Defendant Javier Esquivel in court with attorney James M. Dickinson.  Cody John Horlacher appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Arraignment scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Javier Esquivel in court with attorney James M. Dickinson.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary Hearing requested. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant Javier Esquivel appeared, Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH T.L.B. OR HER RESIDENCE. NO CONTACT WITH ANY DOMESTIC ANIMALS.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

15-4514 & 15-4515
Defendant Javier Esquivel present in court, in custody via video with attorney Michael Fitzsimmons for bond purposes only. Daniel Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
